content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Split the markdown document into lines
    lines = split(md, '\n')

    # Initialize an empty string for storing the extracted code blocks
    result = ""

    # Loop through each line of the markdown document
    for (i, line) in enumerate(lines)
        # Check if it's a code fence line
        if startswith(line, '# Julia') || startswith(line, '```julia')
            code_blocks = []

            # Loop through lines until the next code fence or end of document is reached
            while i < length(lines) && !((startswith(lines[i], '# Julia') || startswith(lines[i], '```julia')) || (length(result) > 0))
                # Append the line to the code blocks if it's not a code fence or end of document
                if !startswith(lines[i], '# Julia') && !startswith(lines[i], '```julia') && (length(result) == 0 || startswith(lines[i-1], '# Julia') || startswith(lines[i-1], '```julia'))
                    push!(code_blocks, lines[i])
                end

                # Increment the index of the current line to move on to the next line
                i += 1
            end

            # Join the extracted code blocks together with a newline and append it to the result string
            result *= join(code_blocks, '\n') * "\n"
        end
    end

    return result
end
